channel.title: web browser on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in web browser on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Coc Coc Logo Cốc Cốc browser is a freeware web browser focused on the Vietnamese market, developed by Vietnamese company Cốc Cốc and based on Chromium open source code. Cốc Cốc is available for Windows, Windows Phone, Android, and macOS operating systems and supports both English and Vietnamese. Cốc Cốc also has a search engine called Cốc Cốc Search Engine. Source
You can download theCoc Coclogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Coc Coc
item.description: Cốc Cốc browser is a freeware web browser focused on the Vietnamese market, developed by Vietnamese company Cốc Cốc and based on Chromium open source code. Cốc Cốc is available for Windows, Windows Phone, Android, and macOS operating systems and supports both English and Vietnamese. Cốc Cốc also has a search engine called Cốc Cốc Search Engine. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Otter Browser Logo Otter Browser is a cross-platform, free and open-source web browser that aims to recreate aspects of Opera 12.x using Qt framework while keeping seamless integration with users' desktop environments. Otter Browser is licensed under GPL-3.0-or-later. It works on Linux-based operating systems, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, macOS, and Windows platforms. Source
You can download theOtter Browserlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Otter Browser
item.description: Otter Browser is a cross-platform, free and open-source web browser that aims to recreate aspects of Opera 12.x using Qt framework while keeping seamless integration with users' desktop environments. Otter Browser is licensed under GPL-3.0-or-later. It works on Linux-based operating systems, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, macOS, and Windows platforms. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Konqueror Logo
Konqueror is a free and open-source web browser and file manager that provides web access and file-viewer functionality for file systems. It forms a core part of the KDE Software Compilation. Developed by volunteers, Konqueror can run on most Unix-like operating systems. The KDE community licenses and distributes Konqueror under GNU GPL-2.0-or-later. The name “Konqueror” echoes a colonization paradigm to reference the two primary competitors at the time of the browser’s first release: “first comes the Navigator, then Explorer, and then the Konqueror”.
You can download theKonquerorlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Konqueror
item.description: Konqueror is a free and open-source web browser and file manager that provides web access and file-viewer functionality for file systems. It forms a core part of the KDE Software Compilation. Developed by volunteers, Konqueror can run on most Unix-like operating systems. The KDE community licenses and distributes Konqueror under GNU GPL-2.0-or-later. The name “Konqueror” echoes a colonization paradigm to reference the two primary competitors at the time of the browser’s first release: “first comes the Navigator, then Explorer, and then the Konqueror”.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Maxthon Logo Maxthon is a freeware web browser developed by the company Maxthon Ltd., based in Beijing, China. It is available for Windows, macOS, Linux, and as Maxthon Mobile for Android, iOS, and Windows Phone 8. Since version 6 Maxthon is based on Chromium. Maxthon won CNET WebWare 100 Awards in 2008 and 2009, and was #97 in PC World’s list of the 100 Best Products of 2011. Source
You can download theMaxthonlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Maxthon
item.description: Maxthon is a freeware web browser developed by the company Maxthon Ltd., based in Beijing, China. It is available for Windows, macOS, Linux, and as Maxthon Mobile for Android, iOS, and Windows Phone 8. Since version 6 Maxthon is based on Chromium. Maxthon won CNET WebWare 100 Awards in 2008 and 2009, and was #97 in PC World’s list of the 100 Best Products of 2011. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Midori Logo Midori is a free and open-source web browser. In 2019, the Midori project merged with the Astian Foundation, then has been revamped entirely, switching from WebKitGTK to using Electron. Source
You can download theMidorilogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Midori
item.description: Midori is a free and open-source web browser. In 2019, the Midori project merged with the Astian Foundation, then has been revamped entirely, switching from WebKitGTK to using Electron. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
NetSurf Logo
NetSurf is an open-source web browser which uses its own layout engine. Its design goal is to be lightweight and portable. NetSurf provides features including tabbed browsing, bookmarks and page thumbnailing. The NetSurf project was started in April 2002 in response to a discussion of the deficiencies of the RISC OS platform’s existing web browsers. Shortly after the project’s inception, development versions for RISC OS users were made available for download by the project’s automated build system.
You can download theNetSurflogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NetSurf
item.description: NetSurf is an open-source web browser which uses its own layout engine. Its design goal is to be lightweight and portable. NetSurf provides features including tabbed browsing, bookmarks and page thumbnailing. The NetSurf project was started in April 2002 in response to a discussion of the deficiencies of the RISC OS platform’s existing web browsers. Shortly after the project’s inception, development versions for RISC OS users were made available for download by the project’s automated build system.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Mozilla Firefox Logo
New Firefor Logo The “Firefox” you’ve always known as a browser is stretching to cover a family of products and services united by putting you and your privacy first. Firefox is a browser AND an encrypted service to send huge files. It’s an easy way to protect your passwords on every device AND an early warning if your email has been part of a data breach. Safe, private, eye-opening. That’s just the beginning of the new Firefox family.
You can download theMozilla Firefoxlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.description: New Firefor Logo The “Firefox” you’ve always known as a browser is stretching to cover a family of products and services united by putting you and your privacy first. Firefox is a browser AND an encrypted service to send huge files. It’s an easy way to protect your passwords on every device AND an early warning if your email has been part of a data breach. Safe, private, eye-opening. That’s just the beginning of the new Firefox family.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Opera GX Gaming Browser Logo Opera GX is a gaming-oriented counterpart of Opera web browser for Microsoft Windows and macOS, developed by Opera Software AS. Opera GX was announced on June 11, 2019, the same day as the start of E3 2019. As of October 2020 it is in open Early Access. Source About Opera GX Browser Opera GX runs on both Windows 10 and macOS. Currently, there’s no mobile version, unlike with the normal Opera browser.
You can download theOpera GXlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Opera GX
item.description: Opera GX is a gaming-oriented counterpart of Opera web browser for Microsoft Windows and macOS, developed by Opera Software AS. Opera GX was announced on June 11, 2019, the same day as the start of E3 2019. As of October 2020 it is in open Early Access. Source About Opera GX Browser Opera GX runs on both Windows 10 and macOS. Currently, there’s no mobile version, unlike with the normal Opera browser.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Opera Mini Logo Opera Mini is a mobile web browser developed by Opera Software AS. It was primarily designed for the Java ME platform, as a low-end sibling for Opera Mobile, but it is now developed exclusively for Android and iOS. It was previously developed for Windows 10 Mobile, Windows Phone 8.1, BlackBerry, Symbian, and Bada. Opera Mini Browser History On 16 August 2009, Opera Software released Opera Mini 5.
You can download theOpera Minilogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Opera Mini
item.description: Opera Mini is a mobile web browser developed by Opera Software AS. It was primarily designed for the Java ME platform, as a low-end sibling for Opera Mobile, but it is now developed exclusively for Android and iOS. It was previously developed for Windows 10 Mobile, Windows Phone 8.1, BlackBerry, Symbian, and Bada. Opera Mini Browser History On 16 August 2009, Opera Software released Opera Mini 5.
